overview: From 2025-05-30 to 2025-05-31, elizaos/eliza had 24 new PRs (30 merged), 0 new issues, and 16 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add plugin specifications to core
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds plugin specifications to core

Everything should work as it has, and there should be no need to modify any code outside of core to engage this specification functionality.

In the future, plugins can be migrated to import the v2 specification from @elizaos/core/v2 and we will do our best to support forward compatibility with v3, v4, etc

topPRs.title: Add enhanced Polymarket plugin with comprehensive trading actions and‚Ä¶
topPRs.author: HarshModi2005

topPRs.title: docs: comprehensive CLI docs standardization, updates, and accuracy fixes
topPRs.author: yungalgo
topPRs.body:
**Problem:**

CLI documentation across all commands contained critical inaccuracies and inconsistencies:
Command descriptions didn't match actual CLI help output
Incorrect aliases and missing options throughout
Non-existent commands referenced in quickstart guide
Inconsistent formatting and missing comprehensive examples
Command ordering didn't match CLI structure
JSON examples used unprofessional notation ("etc...")

**Solution:**

Systematically verified and standardized ALL CLI documentation against actual CLI help output:
‚úÖ CLI Verification: Retrieved help output for every command and subcommand
‚úÖ Complete Accuracy: All descriptions, options, and aliases now match CLI exactly
‚úÖ Comprehensive Examples: Added detailed usage examples with realistic names
‚úÖ Consistent Structure: Applied standardized format across all command docs
‚úÖ Professional Standards: Fixed JSON notation and technical documentation standards

**Details:**

14 files updated with 2,122+ additions, 1,309 deletions
Command Order: Fixed overview.md to match exact CLI help order

Critical Fixes:
Test command: -n, --name <name> ‚Üí -n, --name <n> (matches CLI)
Plugins: Fixed incorrect aliases (remove|delete ‚Üí remove|delete)
Agent: All subcommands and options now accurate
Publish: Added registry guidance and continuous development workflow
Removed Invalid Commands: Cleaned up quickstart.md references to non-existent commands
Enhanced UX: Added comprehensive troubleshooting and workflow guidance

**Validation Method:**

Every command change verified against elizaos [command] --help output to ensure 100% accuracy.

**Impact:**

üéØ Perfect CLI Alignment: Documentation now matches CLI behavior exactly
üìö Professional Quality: Comprehensive examples and troubleshooting
üîß Developer Experience: Accurate guidance reduces confusion and support burden
üöÄ User Onboarding: Quickstart guide now works seamlessly

topPRs.title: üìù Add docstrings to `feat/cli-ai-prompt-additions`
topPRs.author: coderabbitai
topPRs.body:
Docstrings generation was requested by @wtfsayo. * https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/4826#issuecomment-2918902800 The following files were modified: * `packages/cli/src/commands/create.ts` * `packages/cli/src/commands/env.ts` * `packages/cli/src/commands/setup-monorepo.ts` * `packages/cli/src/utils/get-config.ts` * `packages/cli/src/utils/publisher.ts`
These file types are not supported * `packages/docs/archive/guides/secrets-management.md` * `packages/docs/versioned_docs/version-0.25.9/guides/secrets-management.md`
‚ÑπÔ∏è Note
CodeRabbit cannot perform edits on its own pull requests yet.

completedItems.title: fix: resolve E2E test compilation failures
completedItems.body:

E2E tests failed with "Unknown file extension .ts" errors
TestRunner couldn't import uncompiled TypeScript test files
Build process didn't compile E2E tests to dist/e2e/

completedItems.body:

The elizaos update --packages command currently attempts to update packages regardless of where it's executed, leading to confusing behavior:

completedItems.title: feat: Fetches plugin registry from Vercel API
completedItems.body:
Refactors the plugin discovery mechanism to fetch the registry from a Vercel API endpoint instead of reading from a local cache.
This change ensures that the plugin list is always up-to-date.

Removes the `update` command as the registry is

completedItems.title: feat: allow configurable shouldRespond bypass types and sources via env
completedItems.body:
This PR allow the shouldRespond bypass behavior to be configured via environment variables.

Since I noticed more plugin message sources are being added for bypassing, I think it makes sense to make this configurable.

Removes the check for existing API keys (OpenAI and Anthropic) in environment variables during the `create` command.

This ensures the CLI always prompts the user for an API key during project creation, regardless of whether the keys are al

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged 6 PRs, including a significant refactor in #4846 (+49/-1462 lines) and improvements in logging with #4838 (+1150/-1118 lines), while modifying 203 files overall (+9396/-8770 lines). Maintained a consistent work pattern with 19 commits, focusing primarily on other work (63%) and bug fixes (16%).

yungalgo: Merged 1 PR (#4845) enhancing CLI update notifications (+504/-520 lines) and opened another PR (#4847) to fix plugin publishing failures. Made significant code changes across 57 files (+2771/-1972 lines) with a primary focus on other work (57%) and refactoring (33%).

odilitime: Merged 1 PR (#4831) focused on bootstrap improvements, contributing a total of +69/-35 lines across 8 modified files. Actively engaged in the review process with 7 comments on various PRs, demonstrating consistent work patterns.

HarshModi2005: Opened 2 pull requests (#4842 and #4832) and made significant code changes, modifying 36 files with a total of +10,749 lines added and -276 lines removed, focusing entirely on feature work. Active today, demonstrating a consistent work pattern with a single commit.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged 1 PR (#4839) with significant changes (+3658/-2004 lines) and modified 198 files overall (+11338/-8720 lines) through 7 commits, demonstrating a strong focus on other work. Actively engaged in the review process with 8 approvals and maintained a consistent work pattern.

HashWarlock: Merged 1 PR (#4837) focused on fixing the tee CLI subcommand, resulting in significant code changes of +2078/-3708 lines. Consistently active with 2 commits, modifying 14 files with a balanced focus on bugfix work and other contributions.

sukrucildirr: Merged 1 PR (#4833) focused on fixing typos across the codebase, contributing a total of +47/-47 lines while modifying 12 files. Maintained a consistent activity pattern with 12 commits today, primarily working on documentation.

imholders: Opened 1 pull request (#4840) to update the README_MY.md file and modified 1 file with a net change of +24/-4 lines, demonstrating a consistent focus on documentation work. Active today, maintaining a pattern of regular contributions.

tcm390: Opened 1 pull request (#4844) focused on allowing configurable shouldRespond bypass types, while modifying 6 files with a net change of +206/-215 lines across 2 commits, demonstrating consistent daily activity.
